titleStmt.title: The Wiltshire ballad, or, A new song compos'ed by an old cavalier of the wonders at Sarum, by which doth appear, that the old devil came again lately there, to raise a rebellion, by way of petition, but by musicks divine and powerful charms, which Satan and saints abhor, such alarms were made, that he fled, and they all kept from harms.

The Wiltshire ballad, or, A new song compos'ed by an old cavalier of the wonders at Sarum, by which doth appear, that the old devil came again lately there, to raise a rebellion, by way of petition, but by musicks divine and powerful charms, which Satan and saints abhor, such alarms were made, that he fled, and they all kept from harms.

notesStmt.note: Reproductions of originals in the Union Theological Seminary Library and the British Library.
